reasoning: Usher syndrome type 1B is a specific autosomal recessive subtype (MYO7A mutations). Overall Usher syndrome incidence is 1 per 10,000-20,000 newborns (~5-10 per 100k births); type 1B represents approximately 15-20% of Usher cases, estimated ~1.2 per 100k. Confidence limited by rarity and reliance on genetic registries rather than comprehensive surveillance.
